sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 24 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C24, the alternating group A5, or one of the five non-abelian groups of order 24.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 24 exist? Provide a list of all such groups and determine whether each group is cyclic, abelian, or non-abelian.
message_2:
There are 15 non-isomorphic groups of order 24. Here is a list of all such groups along with their properties:

1. Z_24 (Cyclic, Abelian)
2. Z_12 × Z_2 (Abelian)
3. Z_8 × Z_3 (Abelian)
4. Z_6 × Z_4 (Abelian)
5. Z_4 × Z_2 × Z_2 (Abelian)
6. Z_3 × S_3 (Non-abelian)
7. Z_3 × D_4 (Non-abelian)
8. Z_3 × Q_8 (Non-abelian)
9. S_4 (Non-abelian)
10. A_4 × Z_2 (Non-abelian)
11. SL(2, Z_3) (Non-abelian)
12. D_12 (Non-abelian)
13. Q_8 × Z_3 (Non-abelian)
14. D_8 × Z_3 (Non-abelian)
15. D_6 × Z_4 (Non-abelian)

Here, Z_n denotes the cyclic group of order n, S_n denotes the symmetric group on n elements, A_n denotes the alternating group on n elements, D_n denotes the dihedral group of order 2n, Q_8 denotes the quaternion group of order 8, and SL(2, Z_3) denotes the special linear group of 2x2 matrices with determinant 1 over the field with 3 elements.
